forecast.name: Today
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly sunny. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 55 in the afternoon. South southeast wind 3 to 10 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain after 10pm. Mostly cloudy. Low around 52, with temperatures rising to around 54 overnight. South southeast wind 12 to 20 mph, with gusts as high as 32 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
The morning sun casts a gentle brilliance over Downtown San Francisco, awakening life with a promising partly sunny sky. The temperature hovers just below sixty degrees, and a soft breeze from the southeast stirs the air, making it a pleasant time for a stroll along the waterfront. Yet, there’s a hint of mystery as clouds gather in the background, indicating the rain to come. As day wanes, expect the clouds to thicken, heralding a shift in the atmosphere. By early evening, a steadfast rain will sweep in, with the winds picking up, nudging the temperature upward while the chance of precipitation looms at a significant 80 percent.

For those venturing out, a light jacket or sweater layered over a long-sleeve shirt provides warmth against the cool breeze, while waterproof footwear would be wise as the city prepares for the moisture of the night. A leisurely afternoon might invite exploration of hidden bookstores or quiet cafés, with a promise of warmth indoors before the rain arrives. Embracing the elements evokes a certain charm—perhaps even an impromptu visit to the coast where the waves, kissed with glimmers of sunlight, offer a moment of serenity before the storm.
